title: Steelers' Metcalf shoves fan during game in Detroit
content: Steelers wide receiver DK Metcalf was involved in an altercation with a fan at Ford Field during the second quarter of Sunday's 29-24 win over the Detroit Lions.

title: Back injury forces Ravens' Jackson from SNF loss
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson left Sunday night's game against the Patriots late in the first half because of a back injury. He said he hopes to play Saturday at Green Bay but will first have an MRI on Monday.

title: Lions own loss after late OPI calls: 'It's on us'
content: The Detroit Lions owned their big loss after late offensive pass interference calls, with coach Dan Campbell saying, "It's on us."

title: Sources: Red Sox acquire Contreras from Cards
content: The Red Sox have acquired first baseman Willson Contreras from the Cardinals in exchange for right-hander Hunter Dobbins and additional pitching, sources told ESPN.

title: Defiant Jags shift narrative, beat 1-seed Broncos
content: After a narrative-changing victory over the top-seeded Broncos in Denver, the Jaguars say they don't want anyone jumping on the bandwagon now.

title: Sources: Chiefs fear Minshew suffered ACL tear
content: One week after losing starter Patrick Mahomes to an ACL tear, Chiefs quarterback Gardner Minshew is feared to also have suffered a torn ACL, sources told ESPN.

title: Jones: Cowboys 'underachieved' in 2025 season
content: Cowboys owner and general manager Jerry Jones expressed his disappointment Sunday with how the season has gone for his team.

title: Crosby leaps Lemieux as Pens' all-time top scorer
content: Sidney Crosby broke Mario Lemieux's franchise scoring record with a goal and an assist in the first period of the Pittsburgh Penguins' 4-3 win over the Montreal Canadiens on Sunday, giving him 645 goals and 1,079 assists for 1,724 points in 1,387 games.

title: ðŸ“¢ 'We ain't write back!': Top CFP 1st-round quotes
content: Mario Cristobal and Joe Judge were among the notables to sound off with memorable lines after Round 1 of the College Football Playoff.

title: With Lions loss, Bears clinch first playoff berth in five years
content: The Bears' thrilling OT win over the Packers on Saturday was their 11th, and set them up for a playoff berth.

title: Quarterfinal first look: Every team's key player, big question, more
content: It's Oregon-Texas Tech, Ole Miss-Georgia, Miami-Ohio State and Alabama- Indiana: Here's what to expect.

title: Logan Lednicky caps dream with volleyball title at Texas A&M
content: The fourth-generation Aggie helped Texas A&M win its first volleyball title in a most improbable fashion.

title: Miami's run game, special teams woes and a pair of blowouts
content: After two nail-biters and two one-sided scores, we've got our quarterfinals. Here's what we've learned from this weekend's games.

title: Week 16 winners and losers: Brown, Lawrence, Nacua lead the way; Allen, Jacobs fizzle
content: Chase Brown, Trevor Lawrence and Puka Nakua led the way with big Week 16 performances, while Josh Allen, Josh Jacobs and Amon-Ra St. Brown were among the biggest disappointments.

title: Most fashionable arrivals of NFL Week 16, featuring Stefon Diggs
content: Before the NFL's Saturday slate kicked off, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

title: Man United's issues laid bare while Aston Villa enter title race with gritty win
content: Problems are mounting for Man United after Sunday's defeat, a result that vaulted Aston Villa into the title race. Can Amorim & Co. turn this around with a thin squad and crowded fixture list?

title: The Jake Paul show is far from over, but where does it go from here?
content: Even in defeat, Jake Paul's boxing career is far from over, but his next move could be one of the most important yet.

title: Betting lines for each College Football Playoff quarterfinal matchup, bowl games
content: Lines for Miami-Ohio State, Oregon-Texas Tech, Alabama-Indiana, Ole Miss-Georgia and all remaining bowl games.

title: Busy weekend for the books: Inside the Paul-Joshua fight, NFL Week 16 and the CFP race
content: In "one of the biggest mismatches in any sport," high-stakes bettors and sportsbooks were happy with results.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Man City, Liverpool eye Bayern star Olise
content: Bayern Munich's Michael Olise is wanted by a host of other top European clubs. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: â€˜Threw 4 bombs at crowdâ€™: Bondi terror probe reveals chilling details; suspects shot training videos
content: New court documents reveal disturbing allegations about the Bondi Beach terror attack. The accused allegedly threw homemade bombs, including one disguised as a tennis ball, at a Jewish community event before opening fire. The father and son duo are believed to have acted together in a planned terrorist attack.

title: India-New Zealand FTA finalised: Bilateral trade to double in 5 years; NZ to invest $20 billion
content: India and New Zealand have signed a historic free trade agreement, concluding negotiations in just nine months. The pact aims to boost trade and investment, with both leaders confident bilateral trade could double in five years. It includes significant market access for Indian services and tariff reductions on New Zealand exports.

title: BrahMos and beyond: How UP is becoming Indiaâ€™s defence capital
content: India's supersonic prowess is taking flight from Lucknow with the inauguration of a state-of-the-art BrahMos Aerospace Integration and Testing Facility. This 200-acre complex is set to become the epicentre for producing the formidable BrahMos cruise missile, catering to surging domestic and international demand, including significant export orders.

title: T20 WC: Finally Samson's moment of clarity? India's T20 'opener' looks to rise above chaos
content: Sanju Samson's long-awaited T20 World Cup opening spot comes after a decade of uncertainty and a revolving door of wicketkeepers. Despite strong performances, he faced confusion and batting order shifts, highlighting the team management's struggle for consistency in selecting their T20I wicketkeeper and openers.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Hindu worker Dipu Das's lynching sparks outrage in Bengal
content: The lynching of Dipu Das in Bangladesh has ignited protests across Bengal, with Hindu organizations condemning the "barbarism" against minorities.  Das, a Hindu from a lower caste, was allegedly targeted for a promotion, with accusations of social media posts used as a pretext.  Activists are demanding action and a boycott of Bangladeshi goods.

title: Microsoftâ€™s new AI huddle: Nadella starts weekly meeting for engineers; no senior manager allowed
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella is accelerating AI development by empowering frontline technical employees. He's implemented weekly AI accelerator meetings where junior staff present directly to him, bypassing senior management. This unconventional approach aims to foster unfiltered insights and drive the company's AI transformation with urgency.

title: 'I remember every face': 2016 UP highway gang rape survivors recount years of trauma
content: A survivor of the 2016 Bulandshahr gang rape, now studying law, shared her family's decade-long ordeal of harassment and relocation after the brutal attack. Conviction of five men offers hope, but the trauma and its impact on their lives and livelihoods remain profound.

title: Priorities changed: Will Williamson wear NZ whites again? Test future 'series by series'
content: New Zealand's batting maestro Kane Williamson, 35, hinted at a potential Test retirement after the West Indies series, prioritising family and a flexible playing schedule.  His casual contract allows him to choose national assignments, with significant gaps before potential future series.  Despite nearing milestones, Williamson emphasises team success over personal records.

title: Gold price prediction: What is the price outlook in the coming days?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are poised for a significant surge, potentially reaching â‚¹138,000-â‚¹140,000, according to Manav Modi.  Silver has already seen remarkable gains, exceeding 120% year-to-date.  Despite record highs, investors are advised to buy on dips, with key support levels at â‚¹132,000.

title: Musk â€˜saysâ€™ it is 'bet on mess and ...', after Google's Waymo got stranded across San Francisco
content: A San Francisco power outage stranded hundreds of Waymo self-driving vehicles, while Tesla's robotaxis reportedly continued operating. The blackout, caused by a substation fire, led to widespread traffic disruptions. Waymo stated its services have resumed, emphasizing its commitment to adapting to such events.

title: Beckham family rift deepens: Brooklyn unfollows parents David and Victoria
content: Fresh rumours suggest tensions within the Beckham family are far from settled. Brooklyn Beckham and his parents, David and Victoria Beckham, have unfollowed each other on social media. Brooklyn is spending Christmas in the US with his wife Nicola Peltz's family. Victoria Beckham is reportedly trying to maintain a joyful festive season despite the absence. The family rift remains unresolved.

title: After cutting Amazon stake: Jeff Bezosâ€™ ex-wife donates billions in 2025; 186 groups benefit
content: MacKenzie Scott has donated over $7.1 billion in 2025 to 186 organizations globally, including universities and environmental nonprofits, marking her largest annual giveaway. This significant philanthropic effort, detailed on her website Yield Giving, continues her focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, with substantial contributions to institutions like Howard University and the UNCF.

title: â€˜Blocked by the crowdâ€™: Bangladesh police on mob lynching of Hindu worker Dipu; blame 'late call'
content: A Hindu garment worker was beaten to death by a mob in Bangladesh after allegations of hurting religious sentiments spread. Police admitted that a massive traffic jam and a furious crowd prevented them from reaching the victim, Dipu Chandra Das, in time. Authorities suggest a delayed call for help may have cost him his life.

title: T20 WC: Hardik Pandya hits top gear - Explosive return vs SA shows why he remains India's MVP
content: Hardik Pandya's stellar comeback from injury in the T20I series against South Africa has cemented his status as India's T20 MVP. His explosive batting and crucial wickets, including a 16-ball fifty, were instrumental in India's 3-1 series win. South Africa's coach lauded Pandya's impact, highlighting his vital role in the series.

title: Kerala mob lynching: CM vows strict action after mob beats Dalit labourer to death
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan assured strict action and justice for Ram Narayan Bakel, a Dalit migrant labourer from Chhattisgarh, who was beaten to death by a mob in Walayar, Palakkad. A special investigation team has been formed to probe the incident, which the CM termed unacceptable in a progressive society.

title: Anthony Joshua net worth 2025: Boxing earnings, career and Jake Paul fight payday
content: Anthony Joshua's net worth is estimated at Â£195 million in 2025, with the majority earned from boxing purses. He also generates significant income from endorsements and property investments. Joshua is set to earn a guaranteed Â£70 million from his upcoming fight against Jake Paul, a professionally sanctioned eight-round heavyweight bout.

title: 'Recovery isnâ€™t optional': Why Chiefs Heiress Gracie hunt chose strength in 2025
content: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt reveals she gained 15 lbs during her 2025 fitness journey, explaining why strength, recovery, and long-term health mattered more than appearance. The Kansas City Chiefs ownerâ€™s daughter shares how intentional training, muscle gain, and consistency helped her finish the year stronger than she started.

title: Brittany Mahomes silent as Randi shares hope amid Patrick Mahomes recovery
content: Patrick Mahomesâ€™ season-ending knee injury has left the Chiefs in unfamiliar territory. While Brittany Mahomes has remained silent, his mother Randi publicly thanked fans for their prayers and support. As Mahomes begins a lengthy rehabilitation, the Chiefs face a rare playoff miss but remain optimistic about his full recovery and return in 2026.

title: J&K: 6-yr old boy finds 'toy' in garbage, turns out to be 'Chinese-made weapon-mountable telescope'
content: Police in Jammu and Kashmir recovered a Chinese-made weapon-mountable telescope from a six-year-old boy in Sidhra, who reportedly found it in a garbage dump. A separate search operation was launched in Udhampur after terrorists allegedly stole food from a house before fleeing into a forest, days after a deadly encounter.

title: Trai's '12-minute-per-hour' cap: Regulator asks broadcasters to comply with limit
content: TRAI has urged broadcasters to comply with the 12-minute-per-hour advertising cap, despite the rule being under judicial review. The regulator insists the regulation remains applicable, even as the Delhi High Court has restrained coercive action. Broadcasters are concerned about the enforcement due to existing financial pressures and declining revenues.

title: Church scare in Singapore: Indian-origin man charged over terror threat
content: An Indian-origin Singaporean man, Kokulananthan Mohan, faces charges for a false terrorist threat at St Joseph's Church. He allegedly placed a fabricated device, causing services to be cancelled. Preliminary probes indicate he acted alone, with no terror or religious motive found. Mohan is undergoing psychiatric evaluation.

title: 'Dhurandhar' and Deepika : Paparazzi tease Ranveer at airport
content: Power couple Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone turned heads at the Mumbai airport in coordinated black and grey winter wear. Ranveer, basking in his film's massive box office success, was cheered by photographers. The spy thriller is now his career's biggest hit, nearing Rs 1,000 crore globally. Deepika, busy with upcoming projects, joined him for the stylish airport spotting.

title: Samantha mobbed at Hyderabad event: Actor faces crowd chaos during public appearance
content: Following a similar incident with Nidhhi Agerwal, Samantha Ruth Prabhu faced overwhelming crowds at a Hyderabad event, struggling to reach her vehicle amidst security. The event highlighted concerns about fan behavior and preparedness of management teams for public appearances.

title: GRAP Stage-IV in Gurugram explained: Timings changed, WFH pushed for offices
content: The Deputy Commissioner Gurugram has implemented revised office timings and a work from home advisory in response to deteriorating air quality. The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has invoked Stage-IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) in Delhi-NCR. State Government offices will operate from 09:30 AM to 05:30 PM, municipal offices from 08:30 AM to 04:30 PM, and private offices are advised to allow 50% staff to work remotely until further notice, as posted on X.

title: 'No energy left': Rohit Sharma makes candid revelations; opens up about 2023 World Cup final
content: Former India captain Rohit Sharma revealed he considered quitting cricket after the 2023 ODI World Cup final loss to Australia. The emotional toll of the defeat, after investing heavily since becoming captain, left him feeling drained. It took months of recovery and self-reflection to regain his passion for the sport.

title: 'Is this your fatherâ€™s car?': Rapido driver assaults woman, hurls abuses in Gurgaon
content: A Rapido cab driver was arrested within hours for allegedly misbehaving with a woman, hurling abuses, and dropping her on a deserted road late in the evening. The incident occurred after the woman requested the driver to lower loud music, leading to an aggressive confrontation and her feeling unsafe.

title: Delhi air pollution crisis: AQI remains very poor; 4 areas slip into â€˜severeâ€™ zone
content: Delhi experienced hazy skies on Monday, with the overall air quality falling into the 'very poor' category. Four areas, including Narela and Bawana, recorded 'severe' AQI levels exceeding 400. This follows a similar trend from Sunday, when the city's AQI was also in the very poor range.

title: Gold price jumps record high to $4,383 â€” What's driving the rally?
content: Gold prices reached a record high, driven by expectations of further US Federal Reserve interest rate cuts and a weaker dollar. The yellow metal's appeal as a safe haven has been bolstered by geopolitical tensions and central bank buying, with silver also experiencing significant gains.

title: French presidential palace robbery: Silverware worth thousands of euros stolen
content: Three men will face trial next year for allegedly stealing valuable silverware and tableware from the French President's residence. The items, including SÃ¨vres porcelain and Baccarat glasses, are valued between â‚¬15,000 and â‚¬40,000. Investigations led to a palace steward, his partner, and a Louvre guard, with many items recovered. The trial is set for February 26.

title: 'India sees chaos': Hasina on 'reality of Yunus' Bangladesh'; blames interim govt
content: Former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina reacted to the death of student leader Sharif Usman Hadi, highlighting the deteriorating law and order in what she called the reality of Yunusâ€™s Bangladesh. She accused the Muhammad Yunus-led interim government of failing to protect minorities and allowing violence to escalate across the country.

title: Aditya rejected Tamannaah Bhatia for 'Dhurandhar' song 'Shararat'
content: Dhurandhar is a box office sensation, nearing Rs 550 crore. The film's music is a hit, especially the song Shararat. Choreographer Vijay Ganguly revealed Tamannaah Bhatia was initially considered for the song. Director Aditya Dhar wanted to avoid an item song that would distract from the story. The spy thriller continues its impressive run, outperforming major Hollywood releases.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 above 26,100; BSE Sensex up over 450 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Monday. While Nifty50 was above 26,100, BSE Sensex surged over 450 points.

title: CBSE releases important notice on Hub & Spoke School Model; announces orientation programme
content: CBSE has announced an orientation programme for schools under its Hub and Spoke School Model to strengthen collaboration, resource sharing and student well-being. Scheduled for December 26, 2025, in Jaipur, the programme will bring together school leaders and counsellors to improve implementation, coordination and counselling practices. Registration is free, with limited seats.

title: 'Studied India's success': How can Pakistan's cricket be fixed? Selector reveals blueprint
content: Pakistan's chief selector Aaqib Javed revealed he's studied India's white-ball success to improve Pakistan's cricket structure. He stressed that quality talent, fostered by robust infrastructure and competition, is key to sustained success, not just individual brilliance. Javed expressed optimism about Pakistan's current team, especially with the upcoming T20 World Cup in familiar conditions.

title: Indonesia bus crash: Driver loses control, hits barrier; 15 killed
content: At least 15 people died when an inter-province passenger bus veered off a toll road on Java, Indonesia, early Monday. The bus, en route from Jakarta to Yogyakarta with 34 passengers, struck a barrier and overturned. The cause of the crash and the condition of the injured are still being investigated.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for this week - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services has identified Astra Microwave Products and Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals as top stock picks for the week of December 22, 2025. Astra Microwave is poised for growth in defense electronics, while Crompton aims to expand its market share in consumer electricals, particularly with its acquisition of Butterfly Gandhimathi Appliances.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection Day 17: Ranveer Singh starrer crosses Rs 550cr mark
content: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has achieved a remarkable Rs 550 crore milestone, dominating its third weekend with record-breaking collections. The film outshone Hollywood's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' and is on track to become the highest third-week earner, potentially surpassing 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' and 'Chhaava's' domestic hauls.

title: Maha local body poll results: Mahayuti sweeps 207 posts; MVA restricted to 44
content: The BJP-led Mahayuti coalition has secured a decisive victory in Maharashtra's civic elections, winning nearly 207 out of 288 council and nagar panchayat president posts. This performance mirrors their assembly election success, with the BJP emerging as the biggest gainer. The results consolidate Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis's position and are seen as a significant win for the ruling alliance.

title: Delhi airport assault: Pilot alleges casteist abuse; claims passenger threatened family
content: Air India Express Captain Virender Sejwal has accused passenger Ankit Dewan of making casteist remarks and issuing threats to his family. The captain's lawyer stated Dewan initiated the confrontation, leading to a physical altercation where Sejwal was also injured. Both parties reportedly signed a voluntary statement not to pursue legal action.

title: Elephant toll in Assam rises to 8; Jharkhand cancels 8 trains
content: Elephant deaths in Assam tragically rose to eight after a Rajdhani Express collision, prompting a speed restriction for trains. Meanwhile, Jharkhand's railway division cancelled eight trains due to heightened wild elephant movement near tracks, marking the third consecutive cancellation to prioritize animal safety.

title: 'Dhoka nahi deta': Mohsin Naqvi asked to appoint ex-Pak skipper as T20 WC mentor - Watch
content: Pakistan's U19 team triumphed over India in the Asia Cup final by a commanding 191 runs. Mentor Sarfaraz Ahmed's presence resonated with fans, leading to an emotional plea for his appointment as T20 World Cup mentor. This victory marks Pakistan's first U19 Asia Cup title in 13 years, with Sameer Minhas starring with 172 runs.

title: Building Mars colonies with ice: How scientists plan to make it possible
content: Mars' abundant ice offers a revolutionary solution for future human settlements. Scientists propose using this frozen water as a primary building material, providing crucial insulation against extreme temperatures and harmful radiation. This sustainable approach significantly reduces reliance on Earth-based supplies, making Mars colonization more practical and cost-effective, paving the way for a new era of space exploration.

title: Gujarat Girl Drugs Father, Watches Lover Kill Him For Opposing Relationship
content: What initially appeared to be a mysterious murder to the cops turned out to be an orchestrated crime by the victim's own daughter.

title: Asked To Lower Music, Woman Harassed, Dropped Mid-Ride By Gurugram Cab Driver
content: The Gurugram Police have arrested a 22-year-old cab driver who allegedly misbehaved with a woman and dropped her mid-ride.

title: 2 Ex-Senior Bureaucrats Questioned In Telangana Phone-Tapping Case
content: The newly reconstituted Special Investigation Team (SIT) has questioned two of the most senior bureaucrats from the previous Bharatiya Rashtra Samiti (BRS) administration regarding the phone-tapping controversy in Telangana.

title: Zero Duties To Work Visas: All About India-New Zealand Free Trade Agreement
content: India on Monday announced closure of negotiations for a free trade agreement signed with New Zealand, its 18th deal so far as the country aims to boost bilateral trade and investments.

title: Fake Samsung Mobiles Assembled Using Chinese Parts Seized By Delhi Police
content: In a major breakthrough against organised cyber-enabled and telecom-related fraud, the Special Staff, Central District, Delhi Police, busted a well-entrenched racket involved in illegal assembly and sale of fake premium Samsung mobile phones

title: Bondi Gunmen Threw "Tennis Ball Bomb" At Crowd, Practiced Shooting Before Attack
content: The gunmen behind the deadly Bondi Beach attack last week threw four undetonated explosives -- including a "tennis ball bomb" -- at the start of the attack that killed 15 people, according to newly released court documents.

title: Chinese Technology Bypasses Bitter US-China Rivalry
content: "Open" models offered by many Chinese rivals, from Alibaba to DeepSeek, allow programmers to customise parts of the software to suit their needs.

title: Should 'Hindu Rashtra' Be Added To Constitution? What RSS Chief Said
content: Stressing that India is a "Hindu nation," Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) Chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said that no constitutional approval is needed as it is the "truth".

title: "Peace Will Prevail In Manipur, But It Will Take Time": Mohan Bhagwat
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said it would take time to resolve differences among warring sides in ethnic strife-torn Manipur, exuding confidence that peace will ultimately prevail in the northeastern state.

title: BJP Got Rs 6,654 Crore In Donations In 2024-25, Congress Saw Huge Dip
content: The BJP received Rs 6,654.93 crore in donations during the 2024-25 financial year, also a Lok Sabha election year, registering a 68 per cent jump compared to the previous year.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Ten Reasons Why Modi Government Should Not Have Killed MGNREGA
content: The original objective of MGNREGA was guarantee, livelihood and security. This Bill kills all three of these.

title: New Zealand Finalises Trade Deal With India: Report
content: New Zealand has finalised a free-trade agreement with India, local media, including BusinessDesk and Radio NZ, reported, citing unidentified officials.

title: H-1B Visa Holders Who Returned To Renew Work Permits Stranded In India
content: The US State Department, in an email, reportedly informed the Indian workers that their interviews were delayed due to the new social media vetting policy.

title: Karnataka Man Beats To Death Pregnant Teen Daughter For Inter-Caste Marriage
content: A 19-year-old pregnant woman was allegedly killed by her father over marrying a man from another caste despite strong opposition from the family in Karnataka's Hubballi.

title: Video: Thousands Of Aspirants Sit For Government Exam On Airstrip In Odisha
content: More than 8,000 aspirants, including highly educated candidates, appeared for a Home Guard recruitment exam in Odisha.

title: Pune Local Polls Victory Celebrations Turn Tragic, Councilor Among 16 Injured In Fire
content: The incident took place during a victory procession of newly elected councillors and party workers in Pune.

title: "Can't Demand My Return For Political Assassination": Sheikh Hasina
content: Violence has become the norm in Bangladesh, and the interim government headed by Muhammad Yunus is either in denial or powerless to stop it, the country's ousted Prime Minister, Sheikh Hasina, has said

title: Mumbai-Bound Air India Flight Returns Delhi After Take-Off Due To Tech Issue
content: Air India on Monday said a Mumbai-bound flight returned to Delhi shortly after take-off due to a technical issue. The aircraft landed safely at Delhi and the passengers and crew have disembarked, the airline said in a statement.

title: "Its Death Is Our Moral Failure": Sonia Gandhi Slams Centre On MGNREGA
content: Congress Parliamentary Party Chairperson Sonia Gandhi launched a sharp attack on the Central government, accusing it of dismantling the rights-based legislative framework through its proposed changes to MGNREGA

title: Indian-Origin Singaporean Arrested For Placing Fake Bomb At Church
content: An Indian-origin Singaporean man was charged on Monday with making a false terrorist threat at a church where all services for the day were cancelled

title: Let's overreact to NFL Week 16: Broncos won't be the 1-seed? Macdonald is COY?
content: the pre-Sunday NFL Week 16 games were completely wild and massively consequential . the results feel weightier, mainly because there isn't much time left to fix problems that result from them . if the Buccaneers lose a playoff spot, they will meet again in week 18 .

title: Our reporters make sense of Week 16: Statement wins for Patriots, Jaguars, Panthers, Steelers, Bears
content: a game between the Rams and the Seahawks began with a Thursday night contest . the game was the first of the season, as the Bears beat the Packers . in the early window, the Panthers moved into first place in the NFC South .

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: 'Tis the szn': Chargers troll Cowboys multiple times after victory
content: the Los Angeles Chargers beat the Dallas Cowboys 34-17 on the road . it's their fourth straight win in a row . the team edited a clip from the 2004 film "The Polar Express" the conductor punches an "L" on a ticket for the cowboys.

content: Sunday Times 'honours' the newsmakers who spice up 2025 . they're given a match-winning 87 runs off 78 balls and two crucial wickets . he suggested people should work 90 hours a week, preferably also on Sunday .

title: Women's NCAA volleyball Way-Too-Early Top 10 for 2026
content: the transfer portal has yet to take hold in full . many rosters could get a shake up in the coming weeks . this top 10 is based on what we know now and is a little peek into how the run to next season's final four in San Antonio could shake out .

title: Mid-air scare: Mumbai bound Air India flight returns to Delhi after one engine shutdown
content: VT-ALS returned safely to Delhi after one engine shutdown . the twin engine aircraft had taken off as AI 887 for Mumbai at 6.10 am and was back around 6.52 am, per flight tracing sites . passengers boarding commenced at 9.06 am and the alternate aircraft is expected to take off around 10 am .

title: UDF withdraws dawn-to-dusk hartal at Perinthalmanna in Keralaâ€™s Malappuram
content: Decision after police take into custody five activists of CPI(M) allegedly involved in attack on local office of IUML a day earlier

title: Ernakulam General Hospital in Kerala to conduct its first heart transplant; organ to go to Nepali girl
content: Heart, retrieved from a Kollam native declared brain dead at Thiruvananthapuram MCH following road accident, set to be transplanted to Nepali national Durga Kami, who has been seeking medical help in India for close to a year

title: Cold weather persists in Punjab, Haryana; temperatures stay above normal
content: Chandigarh, the joint capital of both States, recorded a low of 8.3 degrees Celsius, one degree above normal

title: RiNK Initiative by KLE CTIE at the Mundhe Banni Startup Meetup
content: This programme seeks to reverse talent migration by facilitating tech professionalsâ€™ return from metros and enabling GCCs, startups, and enterprises to scale in North Karnataka

title: Grassroots outreach, development vision helped BJP win local polls: Chavan
content: Mahayuti alliance of the BJP, Shiv Sena, and NCP on Sunday (December 22, 2025) swept the elections to 288 municipal councils and nagar panchayats, winning 207 posts of presidents in the local bodies

title: Priyank Kharge claims VB-G RAM G act undermines MGNREGA's rights-based framework
content: "Much has been spoken about VB-G RAM G Bill. But beyond everything else, these changes will slowly make scheme untenable and eventually kill idea of a rights-based rural employment guarantee," sasy Priyank Kharge

title: Supreme Court refuses to list urgent plea against PMO offering chadar to Ajmer Sharif Dargah on Dec. 22
content: The lawyer making the mentioning in court said the offer of the ceremonial cloth on behalf of the Prime Minister would send a wrong message

title: MLA urges to administer polio drops to eligible children
content: Chief Executive Officer of Zilla Panchayat Lavish Ordia said that the drive began on December 21 and would continue till December 24 to ensure that all eligible children are administered polio drops compulsorily

title: Forensic report clears actor Shine Tom Chacko of drug use charges
content: The drug case was registered after Shine Tom Chacko created quite a stir by fleeing a hotel in Kochi during a raid conducted by District Anti-Narcotics Special Action Force in April

title: Pregnant woman killed for intercaste marriage in Karnataka; husband, in-laws injured
content: In a case of reported honour killing, a pregnant young woman who had returned to the village few months after her intercaste marriage, was attacked with lethal weapons resulting in her death in the hospital. Her husband and in laws have also sustained injuries.

title: Petrol pump dealers in Manipur threaten to shut operations over extortion demands
content: â€œDeeply disappointed that the government has taken no concrete action regarding their security, even as a memorandum about it was submitted to Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla on December 10,â€ says MPDF

title: Air Indiaâ€™s Mumbai-bound B777 plane returns to Delhi due to right engine issue
content: The plane, carrying around 335 people, was airborne for nearly an hour before returning to Delhi. The aircraft made an emergency landing

title: Scientists should take technology to farms, says Minister
content: He was speaking at the inauguration of the Horticulture Mela in the University of Horticulture Sciences in Bagalkot

title: Senior citizen duped of â‚¹23.5 lakh on threat of digital arrest in Thane district
content: "The complainant alleged that two unidentified persons cheated him of â‚¹23.5 lakh by threatening to place him under digital arrest and forced him to transfer money through online transactions between December 8 and 12," says Assistant Inspector

title: Tiger trapped in Keralaâ€™s Pathanamthitta after repeated attacks on livestock
content: Forest officials say the tiger had killed buffaloes, dogs and goats belonging to farms and residences at Kumbalathamon, which is located close to forest area

title: Resolving differences among warring groups in Manipur will take time: Mohan Bhagwat
content: Mr. Bhagwat, who recently visited Manipur, said he had held talks with all tribal and social leaders as well as youth representatives of the State

title: IAF MI-17 helicopter transports Pench tigress from MP's Sukatra airstrip to Rajasthan
content: The big cat was surrounded by elephants several times from morning to afternoon, before being tranquillised and brought to Sukatra airstrip

title: What is the Aland voter fraud case? | Explained
content: When did the Election Commission file a complaint with respect to irregularities in Form 7s from the Aland assembly constituency in Kalaburagi? Why did the investigation hit a roadblock? What loopholes within the National Votersâ€™ Service Portal did the alleged fraudsters exploit?

title: State Highways begins second phase of widening of Tiruvannamalai - Avalurpet Main Road
content: Funded under the Chief Ministerâ€™s Road Development Plan (CMRDP) 2024â€“25, the second phase will be taken up at a cost of â‚¹64 crore

title: ThriveTN 2026 summit to be held in Chennai on January 24
content: 300 MSMEs will be identified and supported to develop import-substitution products across the six sectors

title: Archaeologists should simplify complex technical terms of findings for public understanding, says Vedachalam

title: Gurugram University option should be added to CBSE recruitment application website: Delhi Panchayat Sangh

title: Ensuring selection process is transparent and merit-based top priority , says new UPESSC chairman Prashant Kumar
content: Technology-based processes will be strengthened by the commission to carry out recruitment in a timely manner

title: The Jats draw up new power plans
content: Members of the community, who held significant power in north Indian politics for decades, have lost their grip on it over the past few years due to various social, political, and economic factors. Now, they are seeking new alliances among other agrarian communities to revive their influence, evident from recent conferences andÂ panchayats, findsÂ Ashok Kumar

title: A model tribal school in Maharashtra battles water scarcity to fight migration
content: The Hiwali school has been seeking solar power and a KT dam or Kolhapur-Type Weir, a low-cost, gravity-based riverbed structure that acts as a small dam or barrage to store post-monsoon river flow for water supply

title: 'What about your Hindu wife Usha?': Row over JD Vance saying US will always be a Christian nation

title: SIR in Tamil Nadu leads to deletion of 2.6 lakh more women than men from electoral rolls
content: Data points to marriage-related migration being the cause behind higher deletions of womenâ€™s names from electoral rolls

title: A gripping account from prison and a powerful argument for reforms
content: The book Oru Thooku Kaithiyin Vaakumoolam, authored by Selvam, who was once condemned to death for a murder, goes far beyond his personal story and his 31 years in prison. It provides a detailed account of the turf wars that engulfed Kanniyakumari district in the late 1980s

title: President grants assent to SHANTI Bill that opens up nuclear sector for private participation
content: The law enables private companies and joint ventures to build, own, operate and decommission nuclear power plants under a license from the government

title: Watch: Centre rejects mining claims, says Aravalli hills remain protected
content: The Centre has rejected reports that the definition of the Aravalli hills was changed to permit large-scale mining, citing a Supreme Court-ordered freeze on new leases. The clarification follows controversy over the â€œ100-metreâ€ criterion used to define hills across states.

title: Suspended Trinamool MLA Humayun Kabir announces plans to float new political party
content: The announcement of the construction of Babri Masjid at Beldanga that has drawn large crowds to the venue; Every day, hundreds of people bring bricks to the venue and offer donations for the construction of the mosque

title: Bengal police warn against drawing a parallel between Bangladesh murder and Murshidabad lynching
content: The police warn of action against those attempting to communalise criminal incidents. Several BJP leaders had made references to the lynching of a father-son duo in Murshidabad in April 2025, against the backdrop of the recent murder of Dipu Chandra Das in Bangladesh.

title: Newly elected local body members in Ernakulam take oath amid cheers
content: A total of 2,220 representatives, elected to 111 local bodies in the district, took oath at different venues. As many as 1,467 members in 82 grama panchayats, 202 in 14 block panchayats, and 447 members in 13 municipalities also took oath at the respective centres
